intro: Alchemilla oirotica, commonly known as the alpine lady’s mantle, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage that resembles a mantle. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Alchemilla oirotica is often used in rock gardens and alpine landscapes due to its ornamental value and hardiness.
